meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel isolated or estranged.
meanings.sent1: Being mean to others can alienate them from you.
meanings.sent2: Constant criticism can alienate friends over time.
meanings.sent3: Trying to alienate your classmates will only make you lonely.
meanings.sent4: Her cold attitude seemed to alienate everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The new student's strange behavior began to alienate her from the group.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel hostile or indifferent.
meanings.sent1: His rude comments can alienate people and make them upset.
meanings.sent2: Ignoring someone can alienate them and create distance.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat seemed to alienate even the most patient visitors.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to alienate the sun, hiding its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The harsh tone of his voice could easily alienate others in the room.

meanings.definition: To transfer ownership or property rights to another.
meanings.sent1: He decided to alienate his old car to his younger brother.
meanings.sent2: The company will alienate the land to a new developer.
meanings.sent3: She chose to alienate her vintage collection to a local museum.
meanings.sent4: The king's decree allowed him to alienate his lands to loyal knights.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to alienate his masterpiece to a prestigious gallery.
